thread.title: ‘A History of Judaism’ Review: The Book of Books

author: Dominic Green
title: ‘A History of Judaism’ Review: The Book of Books
text: In the Talmud, a pagan asks the first-century B.C. sage Hillel the Elder to teach him the whole Torah while he stands on one foot. Hillel replies with the Golden Rule: “That which is hateful to you, do not do to your fellow. The rest is commentary; go and learn.” In Hillel’s time, Greek skepticism and the Roman Empire had the Jews on the back foot. His dictum remains popular in our skeptical time, which also prefers reason over revelation, and the armed truce of “interfaith” tolerance over open hostilities. But consult the redaction of oral law in the Mishnah (ca. 200), and you get a different answer. In Pirkei Avot,...
